Key Arguments: The legislation will severely impact freedom of speech and expression in Australia.
The Bill allows ACMA to decide what is true and false, punishing those who publish contrary views.
Current voluntary code of practice (DIGI Code) already governs the industry and protects freedom of expression.
The proposed Bill overlooks Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, which protects freedom of opinion and expression.
The Bill includes extreme civil and criminal penalties, likened to totalitarian government measures.
Notable Quotes: This legislation seeks to essentially allow ACMA to decide what is true and what is false, and punish those who publish to the contrary.
The Bill also has some extreme measures on civil and criminal penalties, reminding me of how a totalitarian government would operate.
